messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Family Outings in Oregon
messages.msgSnippet: Have you visited the Beverly Cleary Gardens (I think thats the correct name)? I found out about it on the internet but haven t spoken to anyone who has been
messages.messageBody:
Have you visited the Beverly Cleary Gardens (I think thats the correct name)?
I found out about it on the internet but haven't spoken to anyone who has
been there yet. Is it worth the trip?

Kris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Family Outings in Oregon
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/8/00 1:10:35 PM Pacific Daylight Time, andersen@spiritone.com writes:  Thank you so
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/8/00 1:10:35 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
andersen@... writes:

<< http://www.spiritone.com/~andersen/oregon.html >>

Thank you so much! What a great job you've done. We're just south of Portland
and have seen most of the places but this is a great resource. We haven't
been to Fort Vancouver and the only web site I've seen was woefully lacking,
the one you provided is wonderful. I think we're gonna go there for the
Christmas season.

Kris

messages.subject: Family Outings in Oregon
messages.msgSnippet: I ve updated my family outing page.  These are local places we ve visited as a family.  I ve written very short reviews about each.  The places listed are
messages.messageBody:
I've updated my family outing page. These are local places we've visited as
a family. I've written very short reviews about each. The places listed
are perfect for people who like to do family outings.

If you're new to Oregon, old to Oregon, or just desire to visit Oregon, you
may find this page helpful.

You can access it at:

http://www.spiritone.com/~andersen/oregon.html


John Andersen
"The Cost of Chronic Busyness"
Does filling our schedules to the brim maximize our enjoyment of life?
http://www.themestream.com/gspd_browse/browse/view_article.gsp?c_id=50021
Unconventional Ideas at http://unconventional.go.to
